title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
U.S. consumer inflation accelerated to 9.1% last month, a pace not seen in more than four decades, adding pressure on the Federal Reserve to act more aggressively to slow rapid price increases throughout the economy.

Fresh evidence of escalating inflation rattled bond markets, sparking large swings in Treasury yields as traders shifted their bets on how the Fed and the economy might respond.

U.S. stocks ended lower in Wednesday's session, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq retreating 0.4%, 0.7% and 0.2%, respectively.

---

Celsius Network filed for bankruptcy protection, a month after the crypto lender halted withdrawals in the wake of a collapse in digital currency prices.

---

Netflix said it chose Microsoft to help launch a low-cost, advertising-supported streaming plan.

---

Berkshire has lifted its stake in Occidental to about 19%, nearing a threshold that would allow it to include the oil company in its results.

---

Delta Air Lines said strong demand for travel that offset higher costs helped it turn a profit in the second quarter.

---

Spirit Airlines agreed to push back its shareholder vote on its merger with Frontier as the two sides try to win more support from skeptical investors.

---

Unity Software agreed to buy Israeli mobile-app and ad-tech firm ironSource in a $4.4 billion all-stock deal.
